result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $800.00 to be paid to Kevin D.  Joint and several with Emmanuel Higgins 15CF493.

Pay DNA surcharge as to count one only.  Defendant not ordered to pay DNA surcharge on counts 3, 5, 7, 8 and 9 as it has been ordered on count one.
Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count seven (7), but consecutive to any other sentence. *1/6/2016 Honorable William S. Pocan-credit amended to 285 days on counts one and seven.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims Kevin D. and his family, Gail P., Brian M. and his family, Christina K. and her family and the coactor Emmanuel Higgins.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay mandatory DNA surcharge as to count one only, if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count eight (8), but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.

records.addlTxt: Counts one, three and five.
Counts seven, eight and nine.

Defendant Andrew Carter in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Andrew Carter in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Micheal C.

COUNT 1 IS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 7 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4.5 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 295 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1.5 years.

COUNT 3 IS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 8 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4.5 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1.5 years.

COUNT 5 IS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 9 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4.5 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1.5 years.

COUNT 7 IS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a serve 6 months in the House of Correction.

COUNT 8 IS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a serve 6 months in the House of Correction.

COUNT 9 IS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 5 BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a serve 6 months in the House of Correction.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

AS TO EACH COUNT:
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Kevin D. and his family, Gail P., Brian M and his family, Christina K and her family and the co-actor Emmanuel Higgins.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $800.00 to be paid to Kevin D., joint and several with Emmanuel Higgins 15CF493.

- AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.
- Defendant not ordered to submit a DNA sample or to pay a DNA surcharge on Counts: 3, 5, 7, 8 or 9 as it has been ordered on Count 1.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 8 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Andrew Carter in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Andrew Carter in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court Trial continued at 8:35 am.  The Court rendered his decision and found the defendant guilty as to counts 1: Burglary  - PTAC, As party to a crime,  3: Burglary  - PTAC, As party to a crime, 5: Burglary  - PTAC, As party to a crime, 7: Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor), 8:  Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor), 9:  Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor), as charged in the information.    Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
